# Scale: Melodic in E (Mode: Hindu, Shape: G)

## Overview
The Melodic scale in E, with a Hindu mode and G shape, is a unique and exotic scale that can add a touch of Eastern flavor to your music. This scale has an intriguing sound, full of mystery and tension, making it a favorite among musicians looking to create a mystical and ethereal atmosphere in their compositions.

## Notes and Intervals
- E (root)
- F# (major 2nd)
- G (minor 3rd)
- A (perfect 4th)
- B (perfect 5th)
- C# (major 6th)
- D# (major 7th)

This scale has a distinctive Middle-Eastern sound due to its intervals that differ from the traditional Western scales. The minor 2nd interval between E and F#, along with the major 6th and major 7th intervals, gives the Melodic scale in E its characteristic exotic quality.

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The Melodic scale in E is commonly found in genres that aim to create a mystical or Eastern-inspired ambiance. It is often used in world music, fusion jazz, ambient music, and experimental compositions. This scale can transport the listener to distant lands, evoking feelings of contemplation, spirituality, and transcendence. When played with the right instrumentation and phrasing, the Melodic scale in E can infuse your music with an otherworldly and mesmerizing quality.
